fullText: Ms. Buckley's performance is a tour de force of impersonation that goes well beyond mere mimicry to capture something essential about Garland's tortured artistry.
dtliExcerpt: Ms. Buckley's performance is a tour de force of impersonation that goes well beyond mere mimicry to capture something essential about Garland's tortured artistry.
bwwExcerpt: Tracie Bennett can sing like Judy Garland, more or less, and if you have any interest in hearing her do so, go see Peter Quilter's 'End of the Rainbow,' a play about the last pathetic months of the drug-sodden Garland's life, in which Ms. Bennett gives what amounts to a miniconcert of Judy's Greatest Hits. Be forewarned, however, that Mr. Quilter's script is heavy on bitchy one-liners and light on insight, and that Ms. Bennett's portrayal of Garland-at-the-End-of-Her-Rope is a heavily shellacked impersonation that slops over into shameless caricature.
showScoreExcerpt: Ms. Buckley's performance is a tour de force of impersonation that goes well beyond mere mimicry to capture something essential about Garland's tortured artistry.
rejectionReasoning: claude: This appears to be a single quote or excerpt about a performance, not a complete review with an evaluative verdict about whether to see the show.; openai: The text is a single sentence focusing on a performance, lacking a broader evaluation of the show itself.
